intro: Triumfetta cladara, commonly known as the silverleaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Triumfetta cladara is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
